statement:
A finite graph is planar if and only if it contains no subgraph that is
isomorphic to or is a subdivision of $K_5$ or $K_{3,3}$, where $K_5$ is
the complete graph of order 5 and $K_{3,3}$ is the complete bipartite
graph with 3 vertices in each of the halfs. Wagner’s theorem is an
equivalent later result.

[1]{}

Kazimierz Kuratowski. Sur le probl[è]{}me des courbes gauches en
topologie. , 15:271–283, 1930.
